page.title: 16Local History
page.content: Although the town of Wye is outside the area, the site of the manor house of the Royal Manor of Wye is just inside not far from the present day Wye Court farmhouse. Many of the medieval kings of England stayed here.The Norman church may also have been near here. Other manorhouses are at Buckwell and Trimworth. The history of the area is as old as man in England himself. Neolithic man came here and made clearings for himself in the wooded downland. The Romans had an industrial site on the River Stour, then navigable for barges.Further downstream from Olantigh are the remains of a very early watermill. The most historic building is Olantigh. The home of the Kempes, it was here that John Kempe, (1375-1454), Archbishop of Canterbury,
